original: DAHLIN, Gustaf Richard Daniel, Civilingenjör, Hälsingborg, f Jönkp 16/7 80 av lok-mast C A Udén o Maria Åhsell, gm Ebba Bruun. Mog.ex Jönkpg 98, KTH 98—01, avg.-ex där sistn år. Anst SJ:s maskinavd 01—15, stud arb.planering mm vid nordamerikanska järnvgsverkst 03—04, vkst dir o trafikchef v Gbg—Särö jvg 16—18, Sala—Gysinge—Gävle jvg 19—27. Deläg i B Schrams Ing.byrå, Hbg, 28—29 o i Ing.fma Dahlin & Boltenstern, Hbg, 29—31, bedriver därjämte patentbyråverks i Hbg sed. 29. Led av stdsflm o dess beredn.-utsk samt av kyrkorådet, hvdman i Sala stds sparb. Styr.suppl i Sv Jvg:s Arb.giv.frn 18— 27 o lett fi löneförhandl. Styr.led i föreläsn.-frn i Hbg sed. 38. Förf artikeln »Medaljens frånsida» i Frn Nordens saml.verk »Nord tankar». Led Sv Tekn.frn 98—29. Hobby: Musikkomposition.
translated: DAHLIN, Gustaf Richard Daniel, Civil Engineer, Hälsingborg, born in Jönköping on July 16, 1880 to locomotive master C A Udén and Maria Åhsell, married to Ebba Bruun. Completed secondary education in Jönköping in 1898, studied at the Royal Institute of Technology from 1898 to 1901, obtained a degree there. Employed at the Swedish Railways' Mechanical Department from 1901 to 1915, studied work planning and other aspects at North American railway workshops from 1903 to 1904, worked as a plant director and traffic manager at the Gothenburg-Särö railway from 1916 to 1918, and at the Sala-Gysinge-Gävle railway from 1919 to 1927. Co-owner of B Schrams Engineering Office in Hälsingborg from 1928 to 1929 and of Dahlin & Boltenstern Engineering Firm in Hälsingborg from 1929 to 1931, also operates a patent agency in Hälsingborg since 1929. Member of the Municipal Council and its preparation committee, as well as the church council, chairman of the Savings Bank in Sala. Extra member of the Swedish Railways Employers' Association from 1918 to 1927 and has led wage negotiations. Board member of the Lecture Association in Hälsingborg since 1938. Author of the article "The Reverse Side of the Medal" in Från Nordens samlingsverk "Nordiska tankar". Member of the Swedish Society of Engineers from 1898 to 1929. Hobby: Musical composition.

structured.name: Gustaf Richard Daniel Dahlin
structured.description: Gustaf Richard Daniel Dahlin was a Swedish civil engineer born on July 16, 1880 in Jönköping, Sweden. He was married to Ebba Bruun. Gustaf completed his secondary education in Jönköping in 1898 and went on to study at the Royal Institute of Technology from 1898 to 1901, obtaining a degree there. He was employed at the Swedish Railways' Mechanical Department from 1901 to 1915. Additionally, he studied work planning and other aspects at North American railway workshops from 1903 to 1904. From 1916 to 1918, he worked as a plant director and traffic manager at the Gothenburg-Särö railway. Between 1919 and 1927, he held the same positions at the Sala-Gysinge-Gävle railway. Gustaf was also a co-owner of B Schrams Engineering Office in Hälsingborg from 1928 to 1929 and Dahlin & Boltenstern Engineering Firm in Hälsingborg from 1929 to 1931. Since 1929, he has been operating a patent agency in Hälsingborg. He was a member of the Municipal Council and its preparation committee, as well as the church council. Gustaf served as the chairman of the Savings Bank in Sala. Furthermore, he was an extra member of the Swedish Railways Employers' Association from 1918 to 1927 and led wage negotiations. Since 1938, he has been a board member of the Lecture Association in Hälsingborg. Gustaf authored the article 'The Reverse Side of the Medal' in Från Nordens samlingsverk 'Nordiska tankar'. He was a member of the Swedish Society of Engineers from 1898 to 1929. Gustaf's hobby was musical composition.
